Jane runs a general store, and has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of 800 SDG to purchase clothes and many other items. Aside from this business, she has no other source of income. In five years Jane would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Jane says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items such as clothes.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a resident of Murang’a and a single mother with two children aged three and four years. She has been in farming for twelve years and currently has a farm which produces beans, maize, cabbages, tea and pigs. She has one farmhand.

Lucy has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her pig-farming business. She says this will improve her family's living standards and will help to expand her farming business.

She however notes drought and animal diseases are the main challenges.

loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Poni Betty

texts.en:
Poni is a thirty-three-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children aged four and eight, both of whom go to school. Poni runs a salon, and has been in business for three years. She has one employee. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of 800 SDG to purchase weaves and many other items. Aside from this business she has no other source of income. In five years Poni would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Poni says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more weaves and lotions.

loans.name: Alim

texts.en:
Alim lives in the Sabirabad region. He is 29 years old, married, and has one baby daughter. He has been in the cattle-breeding business for two years. Alim buys cattle, cares for them for more than three months and sells them in the local market. 

He want to buy more cattle to develop his business but he does not have enough money for it. That is why he requested the loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva. This is his first loan, and is for an amount of 600 AZN. He plans to buy two cattle. His dream is to have a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy two cattle.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Davaadorj, 21 years old, lives with his wife in a ger in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife operates a micro-business. Davaadorj and his father have been operating a taxi business using his father's car; Davaadorj is therefore an experienced taxi driver. 

Now he would like to start his own transportation business by purchasing a car. He needs 2,800,000 MNT to purchase a car to start his taxi service. He is a hard-working and honest man, who wants to make a better life for his wife and future family.

loans.use: To purchase a car to start his taxi service.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya, a region known for high production of khat and bananas. He has been in mixed farming for eight years, producing mainly bananas, cereals, milk and poultry. He runs a retail shop and a grocery business. He is married with one child aged four years.

Cosmas has requested a loan of 30,000 KES which he will use to buy poultry birds. He says he has skills in poultry business and that while there are challenges such as poultry diseases, high cost of labour and generally high cost of farming inputs he remains optimistic. He reiterates he will use the additional income to educate his child and improve his family's living standards.

He notes Juhudi Kilimo loan processing is very efficient.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more goods to his kiosk such as rice, sugar, coffee, wheat flour and mobile phone recharges.

loans.name: Jacqueline Claudine

texts.fr: claudine est une femme de 34 ans célibataire, mère d'un enfant de 5 ans qui va déjà à l'école. Elle commerçante dans un marché de la place ou elle commercialise les vêtements depuis un ans. la bonne qualité de ses vêtements, ses prix abodables lui ont permis d'accroitre considérablement sa clientèle. C'est une activité qui rapporte mais la petitesse de son capital l'oblige à se ravitailler en détail et là, ça ne rapporte pas grand chose. pourtant c'est grace à cette activté qu'elle nourit sa petite famille. c'est pour cela qu'elle solliictze un crédit pour s'acheter un ballot de vêtement. ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Une partie des ces bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins et le reste sera réinvesti dans osn commerce.
texts.en:
Claudine is a 34-year-old single woman.  She has a 5-year-old child who is already in school.

Claudine has been selling clothes for one year at a local market.  Because of the high quality and the reasonable price of the clothes that she sells, she has built a large customer base.

Although this type of activity is usually profitable, the fact that Claudine's capital is very small forces her to buy only retail quantities, which doesn't bring much profits.

However, it is thanks to this activity that she manages to feed her small family.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of a bale of clothes.  This loan will allow her to increase her sales, and therefore her profit margin.

Part of her profits will be used to meet her needs, while the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothes.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: Рустамчону 40 лет. Он женат на прекрасной женщине Малохат, которая помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. Он владелец кафе, где готовит и продает гамбургер, хотдог и другие булочные изделия. На воспитании Рустамчон имеет троих детей. Его дети учатся в университете и в школе. Его старший сын Бахтиер студент 1 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса. Бахтиер очень способный молодой человек, он успешно учился в средней школе, поступил в университет и помогает родителям в приготовлении гамбургеров. Рустамчон запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы сына в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Rustamjon is 40 years old. He is married to a wonderful woman, Malohat, who helps him run his business. He is the owner of a cafe, where he cooks and sells hamburgers, hotdogs, and оther baked goods. 

Rustamjon raises three children who study at university and school. His oldest son, Bahtier, is a freshman at the Tajik State University of Politics and Business. Bahtier is a very capable young man: he finished high school with great grades, got accepted to university, and also helps his parents cooking hamburgers. Rustamjon is requesting this loan to pay for his son's university studies. He is hoping for your kindness!

loans.use: To pay for university study

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank and water pipes

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is 38-year-old divorced woman with six children, only two of whom attend school. They live in their own house that is thatched with makuti (palm fronds) and which has mud walls.

Bintiali has been selling makuti as retail to the neighborhood from her home. She says that it has been a profitable business; thanks to it she has been able to provide for her children. Thanks to the sale of these makuti, she can cover her household expenses. She’s been in this business since last year. 

This is her second loan with Yehu and she promises that she will make her installment payments punctually. She will use the requested 20,000 KES to buy more makuti for sale. She is a determined mother despite the fact that she struggles alone to satisfy household needs.

loans.use: to buy more makuti to sell.

loans.name: Joyce Mambo

texts.en:
Joyce is a thirty-one-year-old business woman who lives in Juba. She is married and has two children aged three and seven both of whom go to school. Joyce runs a drinks-selling business, and has been in business for four years. She has one employee. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of 800 SDG to purchase sodas, beers and other products. Aside from this business, she has no other source of income. In 5 years Joyce would like to expand her business and open a bar. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Joyce says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items such as sodas, beers and water.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Famata from Kandeh town, Southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children aged two and six. One of her children currently attends school. In 2000, Fatmata established her plastic and rubber business. She began her business because her parents taught her business; she did not go to school. She works at the business every day expect holidays. Her husband is a driver but his income is not enough to support her family. She says that the main challenge for her business is insufficient capital to run her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more buckets, food containers and plates. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to give her children quality education. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more buckets, food containers and plates.

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru:
Баргигул жительница города Дангара. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Она на протяжении четырех лет занимается торговлей. У Баргигул на сегодняшний день имеется собственный продуктовый магазин, где она работает продавцом. 
Баргигул просит кредит для покупки зерновых и зернобобовых культур. Она старается увеличить ассортимент и товарооборот, чтобы клиенты не утруждая себя могли найти необходимые продукты. Баргигул нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en:
Bargigul is a 37-year-old woman living in the city of Dangara. She is married and has six children in high school. 

Bargigul has worked in trade for four years. She currently has her own small grocery store, where she works as the saleswoman. She is requesting this loan to buy grains and legumes. She is trying to improve the variety of goods and their turnover so that her clients can find essential products without trouble. Bargigul is in need of your help!

loans.use: to purchase grains and legumes

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline est une femme agée de de 52 ans, divorcée et mère de de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 15 et 30 ans, l'un de ses enfants est encore scolarisé.elle est couturière et exerce son activté depuis 30 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. la qualité  de ses services et son expérience dans ce domaine lui ont permis de fideliser une clientèle.Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter un rouleau de tissu parce que son capital alui seul ne peut pas le lui permettre. ceci afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante, d'augmenter ses ventes et ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfice dans on activté  et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Jacqueline is a 52-year old woman, who is divorced and mother to four children ranging from 15 to 30 years old. One of her children is still at school. She is a dressmaker and has been carrying out this activity for the past 30 years in one of the capital's districts. The quality of her services and her experience in this field have enabled her to build up a loyal customer base. She is requesting a loan to buy a roll of fabric, because her capital alone is not sufficient to do so. She is doing this in order to be able to satisfy her growing customer base, to increase her income and her profits. She is going to reinvest part of her profits in her business and the rest will help her to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Punsalmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Punsalmaa is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her two children in a yurt in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, whose name is Purevsuren, is 39 and unemployed. Her son, named Nyambayar, is a student. Her daughter, named Bujiimaa, goes to secondary school. Mrs. Punsalmaa has worked as a chef for a private company for 20 years. She would like to buy a car for her husband so he can start a taxi service business. Mrs. Punsalmaa and her husband are very hardworking and diligent people. They are requesting 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for her husband's new business.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband's new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Gilberte

texts.fr:
Gilberte a 42 ans. Elle a trois enfants âgés de 8 à 19 ans, qui vont tous à l’école. 
Elle habite à Ouagadougou où elle tient une boutique de vente de produits de beauté, de pagnes, de chaussures, et depuis peu, de produits « énergie » (foyers améliorés, réchauds à gaz, lampes solaires). Afin de pouvoir augmenter ses ventes de foyers à gaz, Gilberte souhaite ajouter un service de distribution de recharges de gaz. En effet, sans ce service, les clients sont réticents à investir dans un équipement, puisqu’ils ne sauront pas où ils peuvent recharger leur bouteille, ou alors ils devront parcourir plusieurs kilomètres dans la ville pour trouver du gaz. 
Ce prêt s’ajoute à un premier prêt effectué en juillet pour développer l’activité de revente de produits « énergie ». Ce second prêt permettra à Gilberte d’investir dans 25 bouteilles de gaz (5 bouteilles de 12 kg, 15 de 6kg et 5 de 3 kg) et d’acheter la première recharge de gaz pour les 25 bouteilles. 
Grâce à cette diversification d’activité, Gilberte pourra ainsi augmenter ses ventes de réchauds à gaz et ses revenus. Elle pourra alors agrandir la boutique et acheter un congélateur pour vende des jus et eaux glacés.
texts.en:
Gilberte is 42 years of age, and has three children aged between 8 and 19, all of whom go to school. She lives in Ouagadougou, where she runs a store selling beauty products, “pagnes” (traditional wrap-around cloth), shoes and, recently, energy products (energy-efficient cookstoves, gas cooking rings, solar-powered lamps). To increase her sales of gas stoves, Gilberte would like to add a gas refill service to her business. In fact, without this service her customers are hesitant to invest in a stove, as they do not know where they can refill their gas bottles, and sometimes have to travel several kilometers in the city to find gas. 

Gilberte has requested this loan in addition to a loan she received in July, and she plans to use the money to develop her energy product sales business. This second loan will allow her to buy 25 bottles of gas (five 12-kilo bottles, 15 6-kilo bottles and five 3-kilo bottles), as well as to buy the first gas refill for these 25 bottles. 

Thanks to this diversification in her business, Gilberte will be able to increase her sales of gas cooking rings and her income. She will therefore be able to expand her store and buy a freezer, which she will use to sell juices and cold water.

loans.use: To purchase 25 bottles of gas for her refill business

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 33 years old and married with 4 children aged 11 to 18 years. She runs a food stand business in Torkpoi Town in Bo District, Sierra Leone. Her children are going to school. She's been in this business for 7 years, and she sells rice, onions, stock cubes, peppers and groundnut at the market square. This business is the only source of income she has. She says that her business is doing well. She has requested a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase rice, oil, stock cubes, peppers and groundnut to sell at her food stand. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her children. In the future, she would like to see her business grow. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, stock cubes, peppers and groundnut to sell at her food stand.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат женщина с прекрасной душой. Ей 37 лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. По специальности она медсестра, но данное время она помогает мужу Рустамчону в ведении бизнеса. У них кафе, где они готовят и продают гамбургеры, хотдоги и другие булочные изделия. Ее дети учатся в университете и в школе. Бахром ее сын окончил среднюю школу в этом году и поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса, по специальности Финансы и кредит. Он очень способный молодой человек и свободное время увлекается спортом. Малохат запрашивает кредит для оплаты обучения сына в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Malohat is a woman with a beautiful soul. She is 37 years old, married, and is raising three children. She has a degree in nursing, but is presently helping her husband Rustamon with his business. Together, they operate a cafe where they cook and sell hamburgers, hot dogs and baked goods. Malohat's children are attending school or university. Her son Bahrom has graduated from secondary school and this year begun his studies at the Tajik State University of Politics and Business toward a degree in Finance and Loans. He is a very capable young man and participates in sports in his free time.

Malohat is requesting a loan to pay for her son's university education. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university education

loans.name: Tsedendamba

texts.en: Mr. Tsedendamba is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a yurt in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife is named Altantulga, and she works for a private company. His son, named Munhbayar, is 10 and goes to secondary school. His daughter, named Delgermaa, is 4 and goes to kindergarten. Previously, Mr. Tsedendamba worked for a private company. He has recently started a taxi service business, but he lacks working capital. He would like to buy a new car for his taxi service business. The price of the car is 5,000,000 MNT, and he has already prepaid 2,200,000 MNT toward the car. Now he is requesting 2,800,000 MNT to pay off the rest. He is a hardworking man who wants to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to pay off the remaining cost of the car he is buying for his taxi business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 44-year-old married man. He has four children whose ages range from 13 to 25 years. He describes himself as a faithful man. He operates a retail business where he sells timber. He has been involved in this business for six years and employs two staff members. His business is located within a local village and his primary customers are carpenters. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy logs for his timber sales. His business goal is to improve his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy logs for timber sales.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in the Murang’a area of Central Kenya, where he lives with his wife and four children, three of whom are still at school. His farm produces cowpeas (a type of bean), milk, tomatoes, maize and vegetables.

John has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy farm supplies. Specifically, he will buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides, especially for his tomatoes.

John adds that he will use his income to educate his children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married, has four children, and all of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her mother-in-law). She has a business of selling makuti (thatching materials made from palm fronds) and has been in this business for 2 years.

Fatuma has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings from Yehu to buy more makuti to sell. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to open a retail shop. She resides in her own house that has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more makuti to sell.

loans.name: George D.

texts.en:
George is 31 years old and lives in Jacobs Town with his wife and two children, ages 5 and 7; both children are in school. He and his wife have been running a bakery shop, where they bake and sell sweet bread, tea bread and others kinds of bread. 

He says that because of the business, they are able to send their children to school, feed them and pay their house rent. He says that they started this business by selling cold water and food (restaurant) in his community. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more flour, sugar, baking powders, butter, water and oil for his business. His plans are to expand his business even more and, in the future, to see his children finish high school and attend college.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, baking powders, butter, water and oil for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more products for her new office supply business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Mariam from Torkpoi Town, Southern Area Bo District. She is a widow with 3 children between the ages of 18 years and 22 years. They all attend school. 

Mariama runs a local food market, selling palm oil, rice, beans, gari and nut oil. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business from 7am until 6 pm, 7 days per week.  Her business is the only source of income she has. Mariama says that her major challenge is insufficient capital to invest in her business.

Mariam has requested a loan in order to buy more local foodstuffs like palm oil, rice, beans, gari and nut oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and educate her children. In the future, she wants to expand this business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more local foodstuffs like palm oil, rice, beans, gari and nut oil.

loans.name: Shazade

texts.en:
Shazade is thirty-eight years old and is married. She lives in the southwestern part of Kosovo with her husband and two children.  She is a very hardworking woman. She operates a tailoring and handicraft business from her home.  She has been a seamstress for more than ten years and makes tablecloths, curtains, skirts, and traditional wedding dresses for her local customers.  

Sheazade is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine and additional materials for her work. Her goal is to earn a higher income and expand her business, eventually owning a shop. She is happy about the financial support from KIVA lenders because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family, improving their living conditions and saving money towards her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy a another sewing machine and materials for her work.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is 32 years old. She has two children, to whom she provides the love of both a father and a mother. They live together in their own house.

Mwanamkuu has been running a retail shop for nine months. As with every woman looking to move forward, she wishes to succeed in operating a well-stocked store, where she can sell all the products that her neighbors need. This is why she keeps working - in order to little by little increase the merchandise that she has.

This is her first loan with Yehu, and she feels happy because it will allow her to continue with her plans for her business. With these 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she will buy flour, detergents, cooking oil, and other items to increase her inventory.

loans.use: buy flour, detergents, cooking oil, and other items for her store

loans.name: Alamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Alamatu from Torkpoi Town, Southern Area Bo District. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 18 years and 25 years.  She began this business because she needs a permanent source of income to support her family. 

Alamatu runs a cold drink store, selling soft drinks, ice and radios. She has been running this business for 8 years. She works at the business from 7am until 6 pm, 7 days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that her major problem is the poor electrical power supply in the country.

She has requested a loan in order to buy more freezers and a generator. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her living and increase her business. In the future, Alamatu wants to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more freezers and a generator.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en:
Lorpu is 45 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She’s married and her husband is a businessman. They have a 17-year-old child that lives at home and attends school. Lorpu has been operating a shop for the past five years; she sells alcoholic drinks amongst other things. She says sometimes she experiences losses but not all of the time. 

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks and other items for her business. She hopes to extend her business into other communities and send her child to college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks and other items for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 47 years old and married with five children, aged between fifteen and twenty-eight. She runs a food stand business within a busy market area in Torkpoi town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 15 years and sells rice, oil, palm oil, peppers, and cooking seasoning. She also receives income from her elder son. She says that her business is doing fine and more customers are coming.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more food stuffs such as rice, oil, onions and peppers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay her installments back quickly and increase her business. In the future, she would like to see her business expand. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food stuffs such as rice, oil, onions and peppers.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Isha from the southern area of Torkpoi town in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is widowed with seven children between the ages of 18 years and 30 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

In 1995, Isha established her business within a busy market area. Before her husband died, the couple ran a farm, but after his death she had no one to help her with the farming. So she started a business to generate income to support her family. She works at the business twelve hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the costs of transportation.

Isha requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil, gari (tapioca) and coal. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her children's health and improve her standard of living. In the future, Isha plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, tapioca and coal for her market stall.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mamie from Moribatown branch Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 15 and 22. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2005, Mamie established her shoe business. Mamie began her business because she was a house wife and after her husband retired from his job she decided to start her business to generate income to support the home. She works in the business every day expect holidays, seven days a week. She says that the main challenge for her business is insufficient capital to run the business.

Mamie requires a loan in order to buy more shoes. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her living standards. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 30 years old and lives in Jacob Town; he is married and he is a high-school graduate. He has a six-year-old child that lives at home and attends school. For the past five years he has been operating a shop where he sells cold water by the container and also retails it. The main challenge he faces is that he has limited capital. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more water in containers and renovate his shop. He plans to build a house and send his children to good schools in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more water in containers and renovate his shop.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 35 years old and lives in Martvili district with his family. He lives with his wife, two children and a father. Gocha’s father is a pensioner. Gocha and his wife run their agricultural business together. In particular, they have a plot of land, where nuts and persimmons are grown. The family sells their production locally. Besides this business, Gocha works as an artisan to get additional income. He has a pig as well and wants to expand his animal husbandry business.

Gocha requested a loan to purchase a milking cow. After purchasing a cow he will be able to produce cheese and sell his dairy production at the local open market. Gocha and his wife will work hard to expand their dairy business and increase the income of the family. With the increased income the family will improve their living conditions. Gocha awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and has one child. She sells vegetables at various street markets and at her retail shop. 

Joyce is requesting a loan, which she will use to expand her vegetable stock and buy more sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. She is a very hardworking, self-sacrificing woman because everything she does is to provide her family with the best. Joyce wants to expand production to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Mariama from Torkpoi town southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of four and twenty. She has three children that are currently attending school.

Mariama runs a food stand business within a busy market area; she sells onions, peppers, rice, vegetable oil and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business every day even on holiday, 7 days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. Mariama says her business is doing fine, customers are coming because she opens every day and even at night, when customers come to her, she will sell. 

Mariama has requested a loan in order to buy more onions, peppers, rice, vegetable oil and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more onions, peppers, rice, vegetable oil and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 35 years old and lives in a small village of Tsalka district. He is married and has three children: 12, 15 and 17 years old. They go to the local school. The main source of income for the family is agriculture. In particular, they own four milk cows, 12 calves and sell cheese locally. Also they have a plot of land where potatoes are grown. Part of the harvested product is sold on the local market. 

With the loan received from Credo, Nugzar plans to repair his cattle-shed and purchase an additional milking cow. He plans to expand the dairy farm through adding additional cows, but the existing cattle-shed doesn’t allow him to implement this plan. Once his cattle-shed is larger, he will expand his animal husbandry business and the family’s income from the sale of dairy products will increase. He will reinvest the additional earnings to expand his agricultural enterprise and make it more profitable. Nugzar awaits your support.

loans.use: to repair a cattle-shed and purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Freda

texts.en:
Freda is 34 years old and married with two children, aged four and six. She runs a provision store in Kandeh Town, Southern Area, Bo District in Sierra Leone. Her husband is a security guard. His income is not enough to support the home, so she began a business to have a permanent source of income.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells rice, sugar and tinned milk tin from her house. This business is her only source of income. She says that her business is doing well and more customers are coming because she is the only one that has a shop in the area.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase rice, sugar, milk in bags and cartons of sardines. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to see herself owing a big supermarket store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk in bags and cartons of sardines.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Because of her need to generate an income so that she could improve her family’s well-being, Mary began her business of selling clothes. Mary is a married woman who lives with her husband and four children. Her main clients are neighboring community members. 

Mary is requesting a loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization she has been a part of for one year and that made it possible for her to set up her business and create a better environment for herself. She will use the loan to buy bundles of clothes for resale in order to increase the opportunities in the market, such as responding to new customers that have been referred by the current buyers and those whose attention she wants to capture. This is the reason she is asking for this Kiva loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust. With it, she will buy supplies in larger quantities, which will mean she can buy at a discount as her purchase will be in cash and for a larger volume.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is 46 years old and lives in Kareli district. He is married and has two children (14 and 15 years old) who live with him as does his mother. His children go to the local school. Khvicha’s mother is a pensioner. His wife works as a nurse at the local kindergarten and gets a monthly salary. Khvicha is involved in an animal husbandry business and has two milk cows and four pigs. The family produces cheese and sells it to cheese retailers. They sell pork as well. In addition, Khvicha owns an apple garden and a plot of land where tomatoes, potatoes, garlic, onions, haricots, wheat and barley are grown.  He sells his agricultural production at the local markets. Besides his business, Khvicha has a minibus and transports local people to the capital city. 

He requested a loan to purchase a minibus license allowing him to transport passengers on a regular route. The existing route isn’t his private property and Khvicha pays a fee to serve passengers. With this loan he will be able to economize his finances and increase his income. He also plans to pay a water irrigator tax. Khvicha will reinvest the increased income in his agricultural business and will be able to expand it. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus license to serve a regular route.

loans.name: Renaissance Group

texts.fr:
Mme Léonie est la représentante du groupe RENAISSANCE. Elle se porte bien. Léonie à présenté les marchandises d'une des membres du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans le moins âgé a 07ans. Les 03 de vont à l’école et elle a 03 personnes à sa charge.

Mme est coiffeuse et vend aussi des céréales (haricot). Elle exerce ce métier depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville, à Po et à Léo villages environnants. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes (habitants de son arrondissement). Son crédit passé s’est bien déroulé, elle rend grâce à Dieu.

Mme veut s’acheter  02 sacs d’haricots.

Avec ses bénéfices elle investie dans la coiffure pour s’acheter des mèches, des perles et payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne mieux scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Léonie is the representative of the RENAISSANCE group. She is doing well. Léonie presented one of the group member's goods. She is married and mother of three children. Her eldest child is 17 years old, and her youngest child is 7 years old. All three children go to school, and she has three people living in her care.

For the past eleven years, Léonie has been working as a hairdresser, and she also sells grain (beans). She stocks up at the market of Sector 10 in town, and in the surrounding villages (Po and Léo). Her clients are both men and women (residents of her neighborhood). Her previous loan worked out well, she is thankful to God.

Léonie wants to buy 2 bags of beans.

With the profits, she invests in her hairdressing business, buying hair extensions and beads, and pays for the education of her children. Léonie's goal is to better educate her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of beans

loans.name: Iris Idalia

texts.es: Iris tiene 35 años de edad,  es madre soltera, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Ella tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos comestibles, arroz, huevos, productos enlatados, salsas, condimentos, churros, refrescos, lácteos pan, etc. este negocio lo tiene hace 3 años y quiere mantenerlo más surtido de productos. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar productos lácteos, refrescos, granos básicos, pan, y otros, para tener variedad de productos y aumentar las ventas y los ingresos familiares. Su objetivo es seguir creciendo en el negocio para tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Iris, age 35, is a single mother.  She has a daughter, and she lives in the Macuelizo municipality of Santa Bárbara.

She has her own business, a grocery store.  She sells food products, rice, eggs, canned goods, salsa, condiments, churros, soft drinks, dairy products, and bread, etc.  She has had the business for three years, and she wants to keep it stocked with products.

She is requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy dairy products, soft drinks, basic grains, bread, and others.  She will do this in order to have a variety of products, to increase sales, and to increase the family income.  Her objective is to continue growing in the business in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, groceries, soft drinks, and basic grains, etc. in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Sanu from Kulanda Town, Southern Area Bo District. He is married with six children between the ages of seven years and 30 years. Three of his children attend school. He started this business because he has no one to take care of him.

Sanu runs a clothing material shop; he sells cotton, African lace and brillion. He has been running this business for 20 years. He works at the business from 7am until 6 pm, 7 days per week. His business is the only source of income he has. Sanu says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation.

Sanu has requested a loan in order to buy more cotton, African lace, and traditionally patterned design cotton. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his installments and improve his welfare. In the future, he wants to expand his business before he dies because he is an old man now. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cotton, African lace, and traditionally patterned design cotton.

loans.name: Myrtle

texts.en:
Myrtle lives in West Point. She has eight children but only three of them live at home. Myrtle is a college student. For the past fifteen years she has been selling bread in her community. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit every day as she has more and more customers. She started this business by selling food (rice and soup) from a wheel barrow. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, and oil for her business. Her plans are to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 25 years old and a single man. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Previously, he sold his mother's jewels to raise a small amount of money to open a call center and start selling mobile recharge cards to his customers. He has been involved in this kind of business since 2009. 

He is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB Bank, which he will use to purchase mobile chargers and mobiles to sell to his customers and to develop services for his call center. He needs the loan to meet the demands of his clients. In the future, he hopes to be a successful merchant so that he will be able to buy a phone accessories store and earn an increased income, which will enable him to get married.

loans.use: to purchase mobile chargers and mobiles for his business.

loans.name: Ndolo

texts.en:
Ndolo is an entrepreneur who has made progress in her goal thanks to her capacity for work and love of her family, which consists of her two children. She is the owner of a business which she began five years ago, through which she generates income for the family by selling household utensils. 

Little by little Ndolo has been able to expand what she offers, offering other distinctive household utensils and now she has a domestic market made up of her neighbors, many of whom work. Her dream is to grow and expand her market, but her working capital is often insufficient to meet her goal of prosperity. This is the reason why she is asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Yehu Microfinance Trust, in order to purchase household utensils for sale like plates, cups and pots. She will be able to get substantial discounts on the purchases of these goods as she will be buying in volume, and this is the foundation for the success of her Kiva loan which has her enthused and dreaming.

loans.use: to purchase household utensils for sale like plates, cups and pots.

loans.name: Bermet

texts.ru: Бермет 53 года, вдова, воспитала 7 детей.  Бермет с 1996 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 3,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бермет имеется 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, 3,0 га поливной земли с фасолью и картофелем, ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Доходы позволили Бермет создать необходимую базу для детей для создания их собственных семей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бермет обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и покупку грубых кормов. Доходы Бермет планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Bermet is 53 years old and a widow with 7 children. She has been active in animal and crop farming since 1996, having started her business with 3,000 KGS. Bermet currently has one dairy cow, one bull calf, and 3.0 hectares of irrigated bean and potato fields. Her monthly income from the farm is about 5,000 KGS a month.
This income has allowed Bermet's children to start their own families. To develop her business further, Bermet has applied to Bai Bushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS, which she intends to spend on purchasing sheep for fattening and forage. Bermet plans to invest the income from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purcase livestock and forage

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma, aged 50, lives with her husband and three children in the town of Msambweni in coast province. Her husband is unemployed and depends on his wife's business and income from the children. For the last 20 years, Fatuma has been selling makuti (palm fronds), from her home. But her income is insufficient. Now she is requesting a KES 20,000 loan to improve her working capital and to buy more makuti for sale. Her next plan is to build her private shop.

loans.use: to buy more makuti (palm fronds) for sale.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma and her family live in a small village in Zastaponi district. She is 42 years old and has parents and a married brother at home. Irma’s parents are pensioners and her brother works as an artisan. Irma works as a nurse at the local kindergarten and gets a monthly salary. Besides this job, the family has small farming business. They have two milk cows. With the milk Irma regularly produces cheese and sells it locally. The family also cultivates their land and grows vegetables and nuts there. They also own a vineyard and beehives. The family sells vegetables, nuts, grapes and honey in the nearby villages. Irma is very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work.

Irma requested a loan to repair her house. The existing house is very old and damaged. With this loan she will purchase building materials and renovate it. Due to the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Irma hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Anges F.

texts.en:
Agnes lives in West Point. She is 40 years old, and has four children between the ages of 7 and 20. For the past ten years she has been selling rice, peppers, palm oil, and other items on a table. One of the problems she faces is the rainy season. She enjoy the interaction with her customers and making profit. Being busy makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, peppers, palm oil, and other items for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, palm oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Said bought petroleum that he sold, increasing his working capital slightly. Now he is applying for a new Kiva loan, because his sellers have requested more products as they have an established clientele, and Said's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason why his Kiva loan will be successful: because he will respond to demand by buying petrol at a good price. Said tells the lenders that his Kiva loans have been very useful to him. He says thank you, and may they continue helping him.

loans.use: to purchase petrol for resale.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda and her husband live in the village of Chkhari, Terjola district. She is 65 years old. Izolda and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. The family has a small farming business. They have three milk cows and a calf. With the milk, Izolda regularly produces cheese and sells it locally. In addition to this, they own a vineyard and sell grapes and wine in the nearby villages. Izolda also cultivates a plot of land, where vegetables are grown. She works hard, but still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and improve the living conditions of the family. 

Izolda requested a loan to repair her house. The existing house is very old and damaged. With this loan she will purchase building materials and renovate it. The living conditions of the family will be improved, and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Izolda hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her old and damaged house.

loans.name: Rafael Ricardo

texts.es: Rafael de 32 años comercializa camisas, sandalias y pantalones deportivos, mediante el sistema de crédito a clientes ubicados laboralmente y también vende en el centro de la ciudad en su zona más comercial. Él trabaja de lunes a domingo, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y realiza sus compras de contado, una vez reúne el dinero producto de sus cuentas por cobrar. No todas las veces hace una recuperación importante de su capital de  trabajo,   para hacer compras en un volumen que le signifique descuentos  y también mejores precios para otorgar a sus clientes. Hacer la inversión requerida para responder a su clientela fiel y al potencial de compradores, se convierte en un desafío; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará camisas, jeans, sandalias que han sido encargadas al hacer una preventa entre sus clientes y provienen de un país vecino. Con su inversión logrará incrementar el surtido y apuntarle al incremento de sus utilidades, que es una de sus metas, pues desea ofrecer cada vez un mayor bienestar a su familia,  conformada por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 2 meses a 9 años, que son el motor de su vida.
texts.en:
Rafael, age 32, sells shirts, sandals, and athletic pants through a credit system to customers located at work.  He also sells in the most commercial area in the center of the city.  He works Mondays through Sundays from eight in the morning until six in the evening.

He makes his purchases for cash once he has gotten together the money from his accounts receivable.  He does not always recuperate the important work capital to make his purchases in bulk.  Buying in bulk means discounts and also better prices for his customers.

Making the investment needed to respond to his loyal clientele and potential buyers becomes a challenge.  This is the reason that he turns to a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy shirts, jeans, and sandals that have been ordered by his customers as a pre-sale.  The items come from a neighboring country.

With his investment he will manage to increase his stock and achieve an increase in his profits, which is one of his goals.  He wishes to give his family a greater state of well-being.  His family is comprised of his wife and their four children, who are between the ages of two months and nine years old.  They are the driving force of his life.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, and sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gari and corflower.

loans.name: Konnah

texts.en:
Konnah lives in West Point. She is 48 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of five and 20 years old that live at home and attend school. Since 1990 she has been running a cook shop (restaurant). One of the problems she faces is the rainy season as she doesn't have a good shop. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and making profits. Having food in her home makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, meat, peppers, palm oil, and other items for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children .

loans.use: to purchase more rice, meat, peppers, palm oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a visionary hardworking woman who has had several loans with Yehu. She has a good credit reference since she has been able to repay two earlier loans and is about to finish paying her previous loan. 

Tima has been running a shop for some time, which she says is doing well. To increase her income, she started selling coconuts from her home. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her aim is to open more businesses and continue educating her children.

With this loan, Tima plans to purchase more coconuts to stock for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to stock for sale.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa lives in West Point. She is 41 years old and has three children between the ages of 15 and 20 years old. For the past three years, she has been selling chicken, spare ribs, meat, pig feet and chicken feet at the local market from a table.

One of the problems she faces is having only a small amount of capital. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit that she makes. Having money for her expenses makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, spare ribs, meat, pig feet and chicken feet for her business. Her dream is to become a big businesswoman and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, spare ribs, meat, pig feet and chicken feet for her business.

loans.name: Zauri

texts.en:
Zauri is 49 years old. He lives in the village of Matani, Kakhetii Region, with his family, his wife, a grown son and his parents. His parents are pensioners. Zauri’s wife works as a music teacher and gets a monthly salary. 

Zauri is a tractor driver and provides seasonal agricultural services to local farmers and gets a service fee for the work. At the same time he is actively involved in agricultural product trading. For more than 15 years, he has been busy with selling fruits and vegetables. He knows all aspects of the business very well. His experience and skills helped him to develop his business, and in this way improve his living conditions.

Zauri requested a loan to increase his sales volume. With the loan, he will have the necessary money to purchase a larger quantity of fruit and vegetables to sell and in this way provide a better service to his customers. Thanks to this loan, Zauri hopes to increase his profits and keep moving forward. He plans to repair his house, which is old and damaged. Zauri awaits your support

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Beglar

texts.en:
Beglar is 34 years old. He lives in Tskaltubo district with wife Maya and three children (15, 12 and 3 years old). His elder children go to school. Maya is a housewife. Beglar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to re-start his agricultural business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family has a milk cow, dairy products of which are mainly consumed by the family members. Beglar grows greens on a family-owned plot of land. Harvested greens are sold locally. The average monthly income of the family is 250 Laris. It is hardly enough for food for a five member family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Beglar requested a loan from Credo to re-start-up a greenhouse of vegetables; Beglar used to have a greenhouse, but it was old and was destroyed. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Beglar will purchase materials to construct a greenhouse. He will construct it and grow cucumbers, tomatoes and greens during whole year. It will positively impact the income of the family which will increase and will no longer be seasonal as the greenhouse will function all year round.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Mwanaisha. She is married and has five children. The business started to be self reliant and to meet her personal needs. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 12,000 KES every month from this business.

She would like a loan for the amount of 10,000 KES. Mwanaisha has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional groceries such as tomatoes, cabbages, kales, potatoes, etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 10%. In the future, Mwanaisha plans to improve on the store and expand to open a kiosk.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries such as tomatoes, cabbages, kales and potatoes.

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
He is currently applying for a new Kiva loan because he wants to strengthen his business more each time. 

He plans to use this loan to buy welding wire for his business at a much more special price than usual because he has the capacity to buy at wholesale with his Kiva loan. This will make the investment successful and this is why he’s very competitive when he sells the products and earns more each time.

loans.use: to buy welding wire.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 32 years old. He lives in Tskaltubo District with his wife, Tamar, two children (5 and 1 year old) and parents. The family earns a living through agricultural activities. They have a milk cow and grow greens on a family-owned plot of the land. The dairy products are mainly used by the family members and the greens are sold on the local open market. 

Levan requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a start-up greenhouse, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The average monthly income of the family is 500 GEL. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Levan requested a loan from Credo to start a greenhouse. His loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Levan will purchase materials for greenhouse construction. He will construct a greenhouse and grow cucumbers, tomatoes and greens during the whole year. It will increase the income of the family and their income won’t have a seasonal character any more. The increased income will allow the family members to improve their living conditions, first of all their two children.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old, married to Ezekiah and blessed with children. 

She owns a retail shop, a business she started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She has requested a second loan from KADET Ltd. of KES 80,000, which she plans to use to purchase crates of sodas, bales of flour, bar soap, washing detergents and rolls of tissue papers. The anticipated profit will aid her in educating her children and expanding her business. 

She hopes to see her business expand to greater levels.

loans.use: To purchase crates of sodas, bales of flour, bar soaps, washing detergents and rolls of tissue papers.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 34-year-old mixed-crop farmer, married to Eunice, and they are blessed with one child. 

He has been operating the mixed-crop farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for the first loan with KADET, and he plans to use the loan to buy pig feed for his pigs. 

He hopes to expand his farming activities and thereby improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: To buy pig feed.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 60-year-old mixed-crop farmer, married to Teresia, and they are blessed with two children. 

He has been operating a mixed-crop farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Peter will use the loan to buy another farm and start poultry farming. 

He hopes to expand his farming activities and hence improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: To buy a farm and start poultry farming.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 30 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have three children aged between 10 and 15, and all of them live at home and attend school. 

For seven years she has been selling charcoal, oil, rice, and peppers. She makes lots of profit and has a growing number of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, oil, peppers, and rice for her business. She plans to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, oil, peppers, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara leaves in Tiribe, Kenya. She is a good entrepreneur, and for thirteen years she has owned her own retail business. She operates her business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. 

Today her dreams continue to grow and her goals are to continue increasing her income so that she can expand to a big wholesale and to be very successful.

Her market is growing and so is the amount of capital that she needs to continue providing the products her customers demand, and this will be her fifth loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use it to buy food products, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and household items she will promote in her business with special discounts. She wants to offer great prices to her customers so that she can continue earning their loyalty, and this is why she will be successful in investing her Credit Kiva loan in her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and household items.

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en:
Kamene is a widowed woman and has seven children, three boys and four girls some of whom still attend school. She lives in the Tiribe, Mombasa where she sells dry fish. For the past fifteen years, she’s also been operating her farm selling vegetables and fruits to earn a living.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her business more and more. She plans to use this loan to start another business and purchase bundles of fish for resale for resale at a much better price than usual because her Kiva loan will give her the capacity to buy at wholesale. This will make the investment successful.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 50 years old and lives in Jacob Town, Liberia. She is single and has five children between 22 and 27 years old, all of whom are in school. For the past six years, Mary has been selling drinks in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. However, Mary doesn't have enough stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks by the carton for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks by the carton for her business.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Groupe 4

texts.fr:
Le groupement d’intérêt  économique  dénommé GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAH est né le 10 octobre 2003 au Sénégal. Le terme   Makarimal Akhlakh symbolise une personne qui a un bon cœur,  de bonnes pratiques. Le GIE  a atteint le nombre de 300 adhérents depuis  2009. Son objectif est d’unir ses membres et de leur permettre d’exercer des activités de production agricole et halieutique, de commerce général d’import export et de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiments , d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de pêche, d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures, d’art  et de culture, d’imprimerie et de menuiserie bois, de services et d’action d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture , de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace , de boulangerie et de prestations de services divers. Le GIE vise aussi a consolider des liens d’amitié et de solidarité entre ses membres pour leur permettre d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus et de bénéficier de tous les avantages liés au GIE. Et c’est dans cette mouvance qu’un protocole d’accord a été signé entre le GIE et UIMCEC  au bénéfice  des membres du GIE au niveau national. La première phase  a porté sur  un échantillon de 120 membres actifs divisés en 12 groupes de 10. 
Makarimal  Akhlakh groupe 4 regroupe 10 membres du GIE qui partagent le meme marché ou ils exercent leurs activités de commerce. Ils sont représentés par madame Dieynaba  qui apparait sur la photo, main levée. Elle pratique la vente de fruits depuis 1989. Sa journée de travail démarre chaque jour à 5 heures du matin. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de fruits à revendre. Son intention est de diversifier les fruits qu’elle commercialise  afin d’accroitre ses bénéfices  pour améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille et épargner de l’argent. Elle souhaite dans le futur réussir l’exploitation d’arbres fruitiers dans les grands champs.
texts.en:
The Makarimal Akhlah economic interest group (GIE) was created on 10th October 2003 in Senegal. The term "Makarimal Akhlakh" means a person who has a good heart and good practices. The number of members of the GIE has reached 300 since 2009. Its objective is to unite its members and allow them to exercise farming and fishing activities, general import and export trading activities, transport, industrial, artisanal, building, livestock farming, mining, fishing, hydrocarbon exploitation, art and cultural, printing, carpentry, public usage services, representative, transformation of fishing and farming produce, sale of spare parts, ice-cream making, and bakery businesses, as well as the provision of other services. The GIE also aims to conslidate friendship and solidarity links between its members so that they can obtain the material and financial means necessary to develop their income-generating activities and benefit from all the advantages relating to the GIE. Within this context a protocol agreement has been signed between the GIE and UIMCEC to benefit the members of the GIE at national level. The first phase has been applied to a sample of 120 active members, divided into 12 groups of 10.

Makarimal Akhlakh Group 4 is a grouping of 10 members of the GIE who share the same market, where they carry out their trading activities. They are represented by Dieynaba who is the one with her hand raised on the photo. She has been selling fruit since 1989. Her working day begins at 5 o'clock every morning. She is member of one of the UIMCEC branches and is requesting a loan to buy fruits for resale. Her aim is to diversify the fruits she sells so that she can increase her profits to improve her family's nutritional conditions and save some money. She would like to succeed in exploiting fruit trees in large fields in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits for resale.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.fr: Philomène est une de 41 ans, veuve et mère de 02 enfants dont l'âga varie entre 24 et 28 ans. Elle a egalement quatre autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale ou elle excerce son activité de vente de gibiers et de poissons frais depuis une dizaine d' années. Sa grande expérience, la qualité de ses produits et surtout les prix pratiqués ont créé un climat de confiance entre elle et sa clientéle, entrainant ainsi une augmentation sans cesse de la demande. Dans l' incapacité de satisfaire cette demande d' une part et la pétitesse de son capitale ; elle sollicite un credit qui lui permettra d' augmenter les stocks de ses  marchandises. les bénéfices engrangés seront reinjectés dans son activité et lui permettronst par la même occasion de continuer à s' occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Philomène is a 41-year old widow, who is mother to two children aged 24 and 28 years old. She also has four other dependents. She is a trader in one of the capital's markets, where she has been selling game and fresh fish for around ten years. Her significant experience, the quality of her products and, above all, her prices have created a certain trust between her and her customers, which has led to an ever-increasing demand. As she cannot satisfy this demand and her capital is too low, she is requesting a loan which will enable her to boost her stock. The profits she makes will be reinvested in her business and will allow her at the same time to carry on taking care of her family.

loans.use: to increase stock of fresh fish and game.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy one box of Abidjanese soap, one box of carotene soap, and one box of ointment and cream for women.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is 35 years old. He lives in Imereti District, West Georgia with his wife Tiniko and his mother. Ivane’s mother is unemployed; Tiniko works in a local entity and gets monthly salary of 100 Laris. Ivane leads the family’s small-scale agricultural business which is the main source of income for the family. He has a vineyard and produces wine, which is sold in the village. Also, they have several nut trees and sell nuts on the local open market. Ivane requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ivane requested a loan from Credo to start-up a business trading fruits and vegetables. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Ivane will purchase seasonal fruits, mainly watermelons and melons, as well as peaches and pears. He will sell the products in Kutaisi, the largest town in West Georgia. In fall he will trade with seasonal citrus and grapes and in winter/spring with seasonal vegetables. So he will earn income each season. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly increase the income of the family. It will allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 43, is a mother of four children. She lives in Congo town with her husband, who is an electrician. Her children are all independent and are in college, they are aged 32 and 41. For the past seventeen years, she has had a business selling men’s spray, women’s spray, body cream, hand cream, body wash and many other items. She started the business with initial capital that she receives from her daughter. She is proud of her business because she makes profits, and with the profits she buy more goods to improve the business and improve her life. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, men’s spray and women’s spray for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, men's spray and women's spray.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock in his general shop with items like utensils, plates and basins.

loans.name: Belgica Leonor

texts.es:
Belgica Leonor tiene 43 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Belgica Leonor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, líquido mata plagas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría a obtener calidad en los productos. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. El sueño es dar y apoyar en la educacion a los hijos para que sean profesionales.

En el tiempo libre le gusta leer la biblia.
texts.en:
Belgica Leonor is 43 years old, is married and lives with her husband and children. She lives in the Ventanas Canton in the Los Ríos Province.

Her communal bank is called San Francisco de Sibimbe. It is located in the Sibimbe district in the Ventanas Canton. This communal bank has 20 members who work in short-cycle agriculture. They plant corn and rice.

Belgica Leonor makes a living in agriculture planting corn and rice. She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and sells her products in a market in the same town.

She is applying for this loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers and liquid insecticide. The support from the loan will help her to obtain quality products. She faces challenges such as pests that attack her crops. Her dream is to give her children an education and support them so that they become professionals.

In her free time she likes to read the Bible.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer and liquid insecticide.

loans.name: Carmen Alejandrina

texts.es:
CARMEN ALEJANDRINA tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil unión libre  tiene cuatro hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

 Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

CARMEN ALEJANDRINAr se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos, cerdos. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas cada mes.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de maíz, urea, fertilizantes, líquido mata plagas, ranger. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá incrementar la producción y por ende los ingresos. 

Enfrenta desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. El sueño es incrementar las siembras de maíz. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Alejandrina, age 39, is in a common-law marriage, and she has four children.  She lives with her husband and their children in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

This communal bank is called San Francisco de Sibimbe, and it is located in the Sibimbe precinct in the Ventanas canton.  This communal bank has 20 members who devote themselves to growing short cycle corn and rice.

Carmen Alejandrina grows corn and rice.  She also raises chickens and pigs.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas every month.

She is requesting the loan to buy corn seeds, urea, fertilizers, liquid pesticide, and Ranger (pesticide).  With the support of the loan she will be able to increase production, and, therefore, increase her income.  She faces challenges like pest infestations that attack the crops.

Her dream is to increase her corn crops.  She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, urea, fertilizers, liquid pesticide, and Ranger (pesticide).

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has four children between 9 and 17 that are in school and live at home. She has been selling fresh fish for the past six years now and started this business with the help of her husband.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish in cartons for her business. She plans to buy land and build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish in cartons for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 37 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They both have two children and all of their children are attending school. For three years now Victoria has been selling dry goods on a table in the market. She sells many items such as rice, oil soap etc. One of the most inspiring things is that her business helps her earn more money for herself.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, soap etc for her business. Her plan is to build a house and send her children to collage in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil and soap for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has a small area in her home where she sells food stuffs. This is how she contributes to the household expenses, and to helping her husband financially. Their five children are all adults and independent. 

Her loans have been used to improve her business and to have adequate provisions for her family. Now, with this new loan, she will buy ingredients like cooking oil, wheat flour, baking powder, etc. She says that she has established a good clientele base and she wants to always meet their needs. Fatuma has been in this business for the last ten years, and she hopes to own a cafe in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, wheat flour and baking powder.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 45, lives in Congo Town with her husband. She is the mother of 12 children between the ages of 20 and 34. Some of her children are independent, while some stay with her at home and are in school. Mary has been selling ladies handbags and rubber dishes for the past 30 years. Some difficulties she faces are low sales during the rainy season.

Mary learned to sell from her mother, and is proud of her business because she is self-reliant. She has requested this loan to purchase more ladies handbags and rubber dishes for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies handbags and rubber dishes for the business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is 42 years old lives in Jacob Town. She is married, with four children between the ages of 12 and 19 who all live at home and are in school. For the past 20 years, Hellen has been involved in the sales of use clothing. Her main challenge is the difficulty of getting the used clothing from the store to the local market where she sells. She started this business with a little amount from her friend and she learned the business from her mother. What she likes about this business is that she is responsible for herself and is proud of herself. She has requested this loan to purchase more used clothing for her business. In the future, she would like to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more use clothes for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, age 31, is a mixed crop farmer. He has been in the farming business for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his wife Virginia, who is also a farmer, and their two children. 

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced to the organization by an existing KADET customer. Paul will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for the next farming season. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will ensure the education of his children.

He hopes to export his farm produce to other areas and get better returns.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
